TopicTitle: [Request] More classifications for ships, or custom categories.

Articles.Content:
Is it a lander? Is it a ship? Is it a space station?

No, its a plane!

Planes, Rigs, Boats, Submarines, Airships, Jeb's Fail Experiments, FTL Craft, Power Stations, Power Beamers, Communications Satellites, Satellites in general.

What do all of these have in common? None of them have a catagory that makes much sense.

Planes aren't Ships, Satellites aren't probes and neither is an asteroid mining rig.

Edited October 26, 2015 by FungusForge

I looked into this several months back, and from what I recall it looked pretty difficult/impossible to mod in the way it's designed. But (1) I'm not the most knowledgeable programmer (2) it's worth taking a look again anyway, because custom categories would be super amazing.

1.1 might make this more possible. We may just have to wait. This could be a symptom of the mix of systems in the UI as it is now. If they are adding a satellite system, then satellites should have their own group in stock anyway. Planes should really be in stock as well, though I don't think I would distinguish space planes and atmospheric planes. The rest of these would be best for a mod.

Yes! With RemoteTech, my probe list is hugely cluttered with my satellite networks. It makes finding the actual probes in the tracking station a little hard to find and the list and orbit paths are very cluttered.

Some categories are obvious frivolous, but there are definitely differences between probes and satellites, spaceships (currently just known as ships), spaceplanes and their landed counterpart. Terrestrial Craft would be a good way to group Airplanes, Boats and Rovers into one catagory. (That shouldn't be an issue, I can't think of a situation where you have so many rovers and planes that it would be beneficial to your problem to separate them.)
